description: The Cutleaf Toothwort is a remarkable species of wildflower that blooms in early spring. Its lush, jagged green leaves form a vase-like shape, and its starry white flowers are truly captivating. Its unique appearance is created by its deep, lobed leaflets that are jagged-edged and give it a saw-toothed appearance - this is how it got its name! As if its distinctive foliage wasn't enough, it is also wonderfully fragrant when the tiny flowers bloom, making it even more attractive. With its delicate beauty and subtle scent, the Cutleaf Toothwort is an absolutely amazing plant.
